introduction: Antholon presents an overview of the Human-Computer Attraction major at the Old University, focusing on the program's content, requirements, and opportunities. The presentation covers topics such as sustainability, user interfaces, web technology, speech recognition technology, natural language processing, and design AI. Antholon also discusses the possibility of participating in research projects, the admission rate, and the application process for the double degree program. The video aims to provide a flavor of the teaching approach and give insights into the program's focus on human-computer interaction and design.

sections.title: Section 1: Introduction to the Human-Computer Attraction Major
content: Overview of the Human-Computer Attraction major at the Old University.
Discussion on the program's focus on sustainability, user interfaces, web technology, speech recognition technology, and natural language processing.
Explanation of the design AI project and its potential as a research project.
Mention of the danger information visualization course and its connection to the design AI project.

sections.title: Section 2: User Interfaces Group and Computational HCI Cores
content: Introduction to the User Interfaces group at the Old University.
Explanation of the Computational HCI Cores and their role in building interactive systems that operate via speeds.
Discussion on the intersection of user interfaces, web technology, speech recognition technology, and natural language processing.
Mention of potential research projects in the field of user interfaces.
topics: Intersection with Web Technology, Speech Recognition, and NLP

sections.title: Section 3: Web Development and Internet Technologies
content: Overview of web development and internet technologies at the Old University.
Discussion on the keyboards taught methods that help solve hard design problems.
Explanation of the intersection of web technology, speech recognition technology, and natural language processing.
Mention of potential research projects in the field of web development and internet technologies.
topics: Intersection with Speech Recognition and NLP

sections.title: Section 4: Speech Recognition Technology and Natural Language Processing
content: Overview of speech recognition technology and natural language processing at the Old University.
Discussion on the intersection of speech recognition technology, natural language processing, and user interfaces.
Explanation of the danger information visualization course and its connection to these fields.
Mention of potential research projects in the field of speech recognition technology and natural language processing.
topics: Intersection with User Interfaces and Information Visualization

sections.title: Section 5: Part-time Jobs and Research Opportunities
content: Discussion on the possibility of participating in research projects as a research helper.
Explanation of the strict deadlines for the admission process and how to check them on the Old University's website.
Mention of the double degree program and its application period.
Encouragement to consider the program if interested in human-computer interaction and design.

topics: Speech Recognition Technology and Natural Language Processing
